task_summary: Perceive and grasp a bread piece, lift it, move above the plate, place it onto the plate, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 end-effector operates over a green table mat with a small plate and a bread piece. The robot must pick the bread using a gentle pinch grasp, confirming a stable hold before transporting it. Visual search ensures the bread is localized even under partial occlusion. After grasping, the robot lifts, transits to a position above the plate, lowers until contact is detected, releases, and retreats. Timing and force values are conservative to avoid deforming the bread and to avoid impacting the plate.
preconditions: Robot is powered and homed; workspace clear
Plate and bread are on the mat within reach
Gripper is empty and can open to 0.09 m
Camera provides visibility of the bread
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and search/verify bread visibility.
Detect bread and compute a pinch grasp pose.
Move above, approach, align, and gently close the gripper.
Move above the plate, lower until contact, open gripper to release.
Retreat to a safe height and wait briefly.
success_criteria: Bread is released centered on the plate
No collision with plate rim or table
Gripper ends empty and above the plate
failure_and_recovery: Bread not visible: perform raster scan and re-detect
Grasp slips: re-open, re-approach, recompute grasp, and retry
Premature contact with plate: retreat slightly and reattempt placement
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after the final retreat and wait once the bread is no longer in the gripper.

frame_3.now_evidence: Gripper closes on the bread; first decisive grasp event.
frame_3.predicts_next: Lift/retreat should follow if grasp is stable.

node_specs.description: Ensure gripper is open before approaching the bread.
Quick check whether bread is currently visible.
Raster scan to localize the bread if not immediately visible.
Detection to refresh pose for grasp planning.
Plan a pinch grasp on the bread.
Move to a safe height above the bread.
Approach and align for grasping with tight tolerance.
Gently close to grasp the bread.
Transit to a position above the plate.
Lower until contact sensed for gentle placement.
Back off to a safe distance after placement.

failure_modes: Insufficient grip force leading to drop
Contact sensor not triggered during placement
recovery_strategy: Recompute grasp and re-approach if unstable
Slightly increase approach height or re-center above plate
Abort placement and retreat if unexpected force spike
assumptions: Although the instruction says 'picking a bread', the frames clearly show an additional placement onto the plate; the BT follows the frames.
Pinch strategy is appropriate for the bread shape; exact offsets are estimated from visuals.
No explicit orientation constraint is required for the plate.

expected_success_criteria: ObjectInGripper(bread) becomes false after opening above plate
Bread ends resting on plate center
No collisions observed and final retreat achieved
